alert.note: Alert for Central Interior; Middle Tanana Valley; Southeastern Brooks Range; Upper Koyukuk Valley; Upper Tanana Valley and the Fortymile Country; Yukon Flats and Surrounding Uplands (Alaska) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued April 20 at 4:32AM AKDT by NWS Fairbanks
info.description: ...Warm Temperatures Through Friday Afternoon Followed By Sharp Cooling over the Weekend... Strong high pressure building over the Interior will keep the Interior under mostly sunny skies and much warmer temperatures. Highs will be in the upper 30s to upper 40s on Thursday, and near 40 on Friday. Lows will be in the teens and 20s. A strong cold front will move south over the Eastern Interior Friday afternoon into Friday evening bringing much colder temperatures for the weekend. The cold temperatures will continue into early next week. This cold front will bring gusty northeast winds to 25 mph over much of the Interior Friday afternoon into Saturday. Gusts to 40 mph along with blowing snow through Brooks Range Passes and over Interior highway summits Friday afternoon into Saturday. Snow showers will spread south with the cold front over the Eastern Interior and in the Eastern Alaska range Friday afternoon into Saturday.

area.areaDesc: Central Interior; Middle Tanana Valley; Southeastern Brooks Range; Upper Koyukuk Valley; Upper Tanana Valley and the Fortymile Country; Yukon Flats and Surrounding Uplands
